p: The estimated imbalance factor across the categories (see Figs. 7, 8, and 9 for details) in every zone confirms that the IRRP (1) fits better than a simple Poisson in the COVID-19 data. The expected value is clearly tilted from the variance. Only when the estimated imbalance factor is unity, the regular Poisson distribution (in which δ = ∞) is appropriate. The regular Poisson is synonymous with no restriction.
